confabulate verb
(UNREAL EXPERIENCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ]
  psychology
  specialized to invent experiences or events that did not really happen: He came to believe that these patients were confabulating. He confabulated a version in which the President praised him for the good work he was doing.

confabulate verb
(FALSE INFORMATION)
[ I or T ] When an artificial intelligence (= a computer system that has some of the qualities that the human brain has, such as the ability to produce language in a way that seems human) confabulates, it produces false information: The AI tends to confabulate by "making up" details to fill in a story. When you feed the model its own output, the confabulated text becomes gradually more divergent from human-written text. Synonym
hallucinate
